image.altText: A Facebook photo of former professional cyclist Melissa Hoskins.

props.synopsis: Loved ones of Olympic cyclist Melissa Hoskins will be given the chance to deliver victim impact statements at the next court appearance of Rohan Dennis, who last month pleaded guilty over the incident which resulted in his wife's death.

title.children: Court anticipates victim impact statements following death of Melissa Hoskins

image.altText: Two power transmission towers in the middle on an open field with a sunrise in the background.,

props.synopsis: Six months after they were mothballed by their parent company two diesel generators could be turned back on to help power South Australia this summer.

title.children: AEMO permitted to switch on South Australian diesel generators during shortfall

image.altText: A court build with a columned verandah and a blue coloured building behind

props.synopsis: A lawyer whose experience of sexual harassment prompted the dismissal of a South Australian magistrate doubts the findings of a second review of the legal profession will spark immediate change.

title.children: Sexual harassment still ‘systemic’ in legal profession, says lawyer

image.altText: A giant burrowing cockroach resting on its back in cupped hands

props.synopsis: While people pay good money to get rid of cockroaches and other creepy-crawlies, Kris Messenger has dedicated her life to spruiking the benefits of bugs. But she says demand for them as pets can have an impact on ecosystems if they are poached from the wild.

title.children: This $80 native cockroach is a popular pet, but there's a dark side to the industry

image.altText: Bryan Coquard points to his chest as he finishes ahead of Jhonatan Narvaez

props.synopsis: Bryan Coquard out-sprinted a reduced bunch to claim a dramatic victory into Victor Harbor on stage four of the Tour Down Under, as Javier Romo saw his lead at the top of the general classification cut.

title.children: Tour Down Under 'all to play for' as Frenchman claims furious sprint win

image.altText: A man holds a photo of an elderly woman

props.synopsis: A 93-year-old man has been found mentally unfit to stand trial for the murder of his wife, and therefore not guilty.

title.children: Children of 85yo woman killed by her husband can't forgive 'evil act'

image.altText: Aldgate telecommunications tower

props.synopsis: Regional customers in South Australia, including the Adelaide Hills, say their mobile phone and internet services have been patchy at best since 3G was switched off.

title.children: Residents in high-risk bushfire zone fear 3G switch-off will stop alerts

image.altText: A semi-trailer trailer on fire at night

props.synopsis: A semitrailer carrying toilet paper catches fire while driving through dry farmland and pine forests in south-western Victoria, but "luck" and cooperation prevent the blaze from causing a much larger disaster.

title.children: Truck carrying toilet paper bursts into flames but bushfire prevented

image.altText: Pizza on a cutting board.

props.synopsis: A franchisee running more than a dozen Domino's pizza outlets in two states has been banned from employing trainees and apprentices at 12 SA stores, after an investigation by a workplace watchdog.

title.children: Domino's pizza franchisee banned from hiring trainees across 12 SA stores

image.altText: Sexual abuse victim

props.synopsis: A child sex abuse survivor has urged other victims to come forward after her abuser — a former South Australian police officer and her then-stepfather — was jailed for four years.

title.children: Child abuse survivor speaks out after ex-cop stepfather jailed

image.altText: A sign in an outback town which says "Welcome to Oodnadatta, Australia's hottest driest town."

props.synopsis: Residents of Oodnadatta, one of Australia's hottest towns, have suffered through two power outages this week as temperatures soared above 40 degrees Celsius.

title.children: Power outages hit one of Australia's hottest towns as temps soar above 40

image.altText: An old stone building with a red dome

props.synopsis: The 39-year-old father was sentenced to more than three years in the District Court after previously pleading guilty to a charge of arson for causing "extensive damage" to the home, in Adelaide's north.

title.children: Father jailed for torching family home in act of 'domestic abuse'

image.altText: an old photograph of women working in an old telephone exchange, with basic computers and panels.

props.synopsis: Gone are the days of manually plugging in cords to connect phone calls but the memories remain for a group of women who brought people closer together.

title.children: Telephonists reminisce 40 years on from secrets, party lines and cyclones

props.synopsis: Evacuation orders are lifted for thousands of Californians, while new blazes ignite in the city of San Diego and on the Mexico border and a red flag emergency warning for critical fire risk is extended.

title.children: Progress made on LA fires as evacuation orders lift

image.altText: The PM with a face mask

props.synopsis: It's been about five years since the first case of COVID-19 was confirmed in Australia. This is what Australia living through "unprecedented times" looks like in numbers.

title.children: COVID-19 hit Australia five years ago. These numbers show its impact

image.altText: A close up of Jack Schlossberg speaking, with his right hand over his heart

props.synopsis: Jack Schlossberg, John F Kennedy's only grandson, has slammed Donald Trump's decision to declassify documents relating to the late president's assassination, saying JFK is being used as a "political prop".

title.children: Jack Schlossberg slams Trump over release of JFK assassination records

image.altText: A boy stands next to an emu statue made of metal scraps

props.synopsis: George Williams has managed to give discarded farm parts a new life while living and learning on a remote cattle station.

title.children: 10yo welder makes winning sculptures from outback scraps

image.altText: A caucasian man with olive skin and black hair walks through dense greenery with a subtle smile towards the camera

props.synopsis: Organic certification is not legally required for a product to be described as organic, but a business making organic claims must be able to prove them. Some producers say a national standard would give consumers full transparency.

title.children: What is labelled organic on shelves could change under a proposed bill

image.altText: A woman, with a panicked expression on her face, holds two children.

props.synopsis: A video of Shiri Bibas and her two young children being kidnapped on October 7 made headlines around the world. Hamas says they've been killed, but many Israeli's don't believe them, and the tragic mystery will likely soon be solved.

title.children: The video shocked the world, and now Israelis are holding their breath

image.altText: An elderly woman with white wavy hair and glasses wears a blue dress with a white flower on her lapel and sits in a home.

props.synopsis: After a renewed public appeal, police have arrested and charged a 69-year-old man with two separate assaults of an elderly woman more than 40 years ago.

title.children: Man, 69, accused of rape 40 years after attacks on Melbourne grandmother

image.altText: A satellite image of a large, four-sided iceberg surrounded by ice and water coloured mostly in white

props.synopsis: The slab of ice — named A23a — weighs almost one trillion tonnes and could slam into South Georgia Island before either getting stuck or being guided around the land by currents.

title.children: World's biggest iceberg drifting towards penguin-packed island

image.altText: Alex Cullen smiling, wearing a black suit and bow tie with a white button-up shirt.

props.synopsis: Today hosts Karl Stefanovic and Sarah Abo addressed the journalist's absence on air this morning, telling viewers he would "finish with the network".

title.children: Nine's Alex Cullen to leave Today show over 'Lambo guy' controversy

image.altText: First responders on the scene of a crash, where a damaged police vehicle can be seen.

props.synopsis: A highway patrol officer has been seriously injured in a collision with a truck south-west of Brisbane.

title.children: Highway patrol officer seriously injured in crash south-west of Brisbane

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Alice Bacon was among the 19 Newmarch House aged care facility residents that  died from COVID-19.

props.synopsis: During the 65-day outbreak at Newmarch House in Kingswood, in Sydney's west, 37 of the 97 residents contracted COVID-19 from April to June 2020.

title.children: COVID spread at Sydney aged care home could have been slowed, inquest finds

image.altText: Axel Rudakubana pulls his lips over his teeth in a mugshot, with his black hair sticking up and eyes looking into the camera.

props.synopsis: Axel Rudakubana, who murdered three young girls and injured several more people in a mass stabbing attack at a Taylor Swift dance class in England's north west last year, is sentenced to 52 years behind bars.

title.children: Teen who killed three UK kids searched for Sydney stabbing video before attack

image.altText: Mark Zuckerberg, Jeff Bezos, Sundar Pichai and Elon Musk standing on a stage

props.synopsis: There’s no official ruling on the collective noun for a group of billionaires, but if ever we needed one it was this week, writes Ange Lavoipierre.

title.children: How the new 'tech oligarchy' under Donald Trump will reshape the world

image.altText: cctv image of two people dressed in black hoodies one on a bike outside a synagogue in newtown

props.synopsis: Several red swastikas were also graffitied along the front fence of the Newtown Synagogue on January 11.

title.children: Second man charged over alleged attempt to set fire to Sydney synagogue

image.altText: Two people smiling at camera with dog in between

props.synopsis: Two sets of walking shoes, sunscreen, dehydrated food and a rain and wind-proof jacket are some of the items Elise Smith packed for her assistance dog Lenny, who joined her for a 65-kilometre trek in Tasmania.

title.children: How Elise's small and fluffy assistance dog made a six-day hike possible

image.altText: Police tape in the foreground with trees and car in the background

props.synopsis: Detectives from the Child Protection Investigation Unit and specialist police from Crime and Intelligence Command's Child Trauma Unit are investigating the death of a two-month-old girl.

title.children: Two-month-old baby girl dies in Brisbane hospital after suffering 'life-threatening injuries'

image.altText: Karla Sofía Gascón walking through a public space with a bag on her shoulder.

props.synopsis: Trans actress Karla Sofía Gascón makes Oscars history, an Australian cinematographer heading for gold and more from today's Academy Award nominations

title.children: All the snubs, surprises and successes in the 2025 Oscar nominations

image.altText: An Australian one-dollar coin, placed on top of US dollars.

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 posts its best weekly gain since December. The Australian dollar rallies against the greenback after US President Donald Trump tells Fox News he could make a deal with China. Here's how the trading day unfolded on the markets blog.

title.children: Aussie dollar hits five-week high, ASX has best week in a month — as it happened

image.altText: Guitarists of Franz Ferdinand stand in line and perform on stage in sharp red and black suits

props.synopsis: Born in a dingy Glasgow flat, Franz Ferdinand's biggest hit became a foundational part of the 2000s indie-rock boom and Hottest 100 lore.

title.children: How the Hottest 100 winner from 20 years ago was inspired by a sniper duel
